result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Luis A. Rosario-Alvarez

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 30, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

AMENDED - No contact with V.G.M. except by telephone or electronic means.  If arrangements are made through a third party, the DE may exercise placement of children if he chooses and V.G.M. is in agreement.

11:00 AM Defendant Luis A. Rosario-Alvarez in court w/interpreter Fred S (sworn).  Attorney Blake Duren appeared by phone for Luis A. Rosario-Alvarez.  Prosecuting attorney C. Remington McConnell in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and appearances.  Court notes victim (V.G.M.) also appears in person.  Court notes there was a petition filed requesting modification of bond and the State objected.  State makes their argument against modification for in person contact but wouldn't object to phone/email/text contact.  V.G.M. makes statement on behalf of her petition.  Court questions V.G.M.  Atty Duren makes statement - requests no violent or abusive contact.  State asks questions of V.G.M.  Court makes statement re: victim's reliance on the DE and how alcohol played a role in these charges.  Court will not grant the request for in person contact but does allow DE to have contact by telephone or electronic means.  DE will have to sign an amended bond.

records.addlTxt: Indigency hearing on August 17, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

2:42 PM Prosecuting attorney C. Remington McConnell in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Luis A. Rosario-Alvarez appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Leonie Dolch appeared by video for Luis A. Rosario-Alvarez.  Interpreter, Fred S - S&T.  Breakout room at 2:43 PM.  Back on the record at 2:53 PM.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised of rights to an attorney.  DE has not yet applied for PD representation.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  State recommends $5,000 cash bond.  Atty Dolch recommends a signature bond o no more than $100 cash.  $1,000.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact with V.G.M. or her residence.  Absolute sobriety at all times.  No possession of any firearms.  DE may return one time upon prior notice and with LE to retrieve any personal belongings.  Not to possess any alcohol or controlled substances w/o a valid prescription.  If a prescription is received the DE must maintain it in it's original bottle showing the DE's name, the name of the substance and the name of the doctor who prescribed it.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Return date scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on September 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on September 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
